Key Arguments: The legislation threatens free speech, open debate, and genuine online conversation.
Factual information can change over time, and the government may be incorrect about what is factual.
The law could be used to silence free speech, as even META has stated.
Governments claiming to be the sole voice of truth are authoritarian and totalitarian.
The legislation could lead to government control of the media and punishment for differing views.
Governments are inherently biased, and the law could be used against any political party in power.
Comparison to authoritarian regimes like Russia, China, and North Korea.
Notable Quotes: If this law passes, it will be the end of free speech, open debate and genuine online conversation in Australia.
Governments that claim to be the sole voice of truth are authoritarian and totalitarian.
Other countries that claim to be the sole voice of truth are Russia, China, and North Korea.
